title: Giant Lizard
description:
6’ long, carnivorous lizards with skin flaps between legs that enable gliding. Usually dwell above ground, but sometimes shelter in caves. Sometimes attack humans.
5’ long, carnivorous, nocturnal lizards. Light blue scales with orange spots.
7’ long lizards whose scales change colour as camouflage.
8’ long, iguana-like, carnivorous lizards with olive scales and a ridge of white spikes along the back. Have been known to attack humans.
extras: 1 Draco2 Gecko3 Horned Chameleon4 Tuatara	Cling: Climb walls, trees, etc. and drop on victims.	Cling: Climb walls, trees, etc. and drop on victims.	Surprise: On a 1–5, due to camouflage.	Sticky tongue: Can attack targets up to 5’ away. If the attack succeeds, the victim is dragged to the mouth and bitten (2d4 damage).	Tail: Causes no damage, but knocks opponent down: cannot attack that round.	Infravision: 90’. Granted by retractable eye membranes.
